articles.title: Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported
Reception Hosted by Secretary of People's Bureau of Libya
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported 
    Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- The Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization made public a statement in support of the Korean people's cause of national reunification on Dec. 26 last year.
 The Koreans are making efforts to bring earlier national reunification through reconciliation and cooperation, the statement said, and continued:
 Korea should be reunified on the principle of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity free from the interference of outside forces as desired by all the Koreans in the near future and the concrete wall, a symbol of national division, should be pulled down. 
 We always support the just cause of the Korean people to defend the peace of the Korean Peninsula and reunify the country and hold that the foreign troops should be pulled back from south Korea as demanded by the Koreans and the people of the rest of the world.

articles.content:
Reception Hosted by Secretary of People's Bureau of Libya 
    Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Bashir Ramadan Khalifa Abu Janah, secretary of the people's bureau of Libya here, who is doyen of the diplomatic corps here, gave a reception Wednesday evening on the occasion of the New Year Juche 95 (2006).
 Present there on invitation were Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of various countries here.    
 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Treacherous Move of Pro-U.S. Ultra-Right Conservatives under Fire
Murder Case of Peasants under Fire
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
Commemorations held in Peru
Korean People Turn out for Hopeful Future
articles.content:
Commemorations held in Peru 
    Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Receptions, lectures, seminars, film shows, reading sessions and art performances were held by different political parties and organizations in Peru from Dec. 19 to 24 last year in commemoration of the 14th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of office as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 88th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
 At film shows Korean films "The Great Leader Comrade       Kim Jong Il Gives On-the-spot Guidance to Work in Different Fields", "The Brilliant History of the Great Leadership", "The Korean People's Army, Steel-like Ranks" and "The New Feature of Korea" were screened.
 Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, said in his speech at a reception that all the members of the People's Front respect  Kim Jong Il, supreme leader of the DPRK, and express full support and sympathy to his Songun politics.
 Teresa Otiniano, chairwoman of the Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk, stressed at a seminar that Kim Jong Suk who devoted her all to the struggle to achieve the freedom and happiness of the people and true rights of the women, is a great paragon of a genuine revolutionary and heroine.    
 Luis Mateo Munoz, general secretary of the Socialist Party of Peru, Estuardo Martinez Perez, president of the Peruvian National Independent Movement for Free Voting's Union, and Angel Castro Lavarello, chairman of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship, in a lecture, a seminar and a film show highly praised Kim Jong Il for wisely leading the Korean people's struggle to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation with his Songun politics, true to the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Suk.
